revisions.content:
{{Infobox set | image = SD3-DeckEN.png | en_name = Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction | fr_name = Deck de Structure: Le Souffle de la Destruction | de_name = Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction | it_name = Structure Deck: Fiammata di Distruzione | pt_name = Deck Estrutura: Chama da Destruição | es_name = Baraja de Estructura: Llamarada de Destrucción | ja_name = ストラクチャーデッキ －{{Ruby|灼|しゃく}}{{Ruby|熱|ねつ}}の{{Ruby|大|だい}}{{Ruby|地|ち}}－ | romaji_name = Sutorakuchā Dekki - Shakunetsu no Daichi - | ja_trans_name = Structure Deck - Scorching-Hot ​Earth - | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＲＵＣＴＵＲＥ ＤＥＣＫ|스트럭처 덱|lang=ko}} —작열하는 대지— | ko_rr_name = Seuteuleogcheo Deg - Jag-yeolhaneun Daeji - | ko_trans_name = Structure Deck: Scorching-Hot Earth | type = [[Structure Deck]] | prefix = SD3 | size = 40 | cover_card = [[Infernal Flame Emperor]] | ja_database_id = 2201010 | en_database_id = 14401002 | fr_database_id = 34401003 | de_database_id = 24401002 | it_database_id = 44401002 | pt_database_id = 14401002 | es_database_id = 54401002 | ko_database_id = 73302000 | jp_release_date = January 20, 2005 | kr_release_date = April 29, 2006 | na_release_date = May 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = May 2005 | pt_release_date = May 1, 2005 | sp-lat_release_date = | prev = ''[[Structure Deck: Zombie Madness|Zombie Madness]]'' | curr = ''Blaze of Destruction'' | next = ''[[Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep|Fury from the Deep]]'' }} '''''Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction''''' is a [[Structure Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the third deck in the ''OCG''{{'}}s Structure Deck series (eleventh including the Character Structure Decks), following ''[[Structure Deck: Zombie Madness]]''. In the ''TCG'', it is the third deck. In the Korean ''OCG'', ''Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction'' was first released on April 29, 2006 in the bundle ''[[Structure Deck: Special Set 2]]'' (with ''Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep''). It was released individually on May 10, 2006. ==Description== {{Quote|[https://web.archive.org/web/20061110051314/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/en/products/structuredecks/SD3.aspx Upper Deck Entertainment]|It's a struggle of the [[attribute|elements]] with the two new [[Structure Deck]]s. Control the waves and crush your opponents with "[[Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep|Fury from the Deep]]" or leave them standing in a cloud of smoke with the [[FIRE]] monsters of "Blaze of Destruction". The [[Structure Deck]]s are ready to play with out of the box, so you can master their new strategies. Each [[Deck]] has 40 cards with 1 brand new [[Ultra Rare]] [[Monster Card]], rulebook, and Dueling guide which assists a Duelist in taking his game to the next level.}} ==Features== The Deck includes [[FIRE]] monsters capable of inflicting [[effect damage]]. Featured cards include "[[Infernal Flame Emperor]]", "[[Solar Flare Dragon]]" and "[[Level Limit - Area B]]". ==Breakdown== Each ''Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction'' contains: * 1 Preconstructed Deck of 40 cards ** 1 [[Ultra Rare]] ** 39 [[Common]]s * 1 [[Rulebook]] * 1 Dueling Guide * 1 [[Playmat]] ==Galleries== SD3-DeckEN2.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] SD3-DeckFR.png | French
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (TCG-FR-1E)|1st Edition]] SD3-DeckDE.png | German
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (TCG-DE-1E)|1st Edition]] SD3-DeckIT.png | Italian
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (TCG-IT-1E)|1st Edition]] SD3-DeckPT.png | Portuguese
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (TCG-PT-1E)|1st Edition]] SD3-DeckSP.png | Spanish
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (TCG-SP-1E)|1st Edition]] SD3-DeckJP.png | Japanese
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (OCG-JP)|Unlimited Edition]] SD3-DeckKR.png | Korean
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SD3-Poster-JP.png | Japanese promotional poster ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR | 1e_galleries = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP | ue_galleries = JP,KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR}} {{Decks}} [[Category:OCG Structure Decks|Blaze of Destruction]] [[Category:TCG Structure Decks|Blaze of Destruction]]

{{For|other uses|''Dark Beginning 1'' (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox set | image = DB1-BoosterEN.png | width = 142 | en_name = Dark Beginning 1 | de_name = Dark Beginning 1 | es_name = Principio Oscuro 1 | type = [[Booster Pack]] | prefix = DB1 | size = 250 | en_database_id = 11103004 | de_database_id = 21103004 | es_database_id = 51102004 | na_release_date = October 12, 2004 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | de_release_date = December 17, 2004 | sp_release_date = December 1, 2004 | next = Dark Beginning 2 }} '''''Dark Beginning 1''''' is a reprint set in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]''. This set is the ''TCG'' version of the ''[[OCG]]'' reprint set ''[[Beginner's Edition 1]]'', containing the exact same cards. As a result, this reprint set actually contains 2 cards that are new to the ''TCG''. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for premier events upon its release{{cite web |title=UDE Tournament Appendix Appendix A: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG Policies |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01nov2004_en.pdf |website=Pojo.com Forums |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |access-date=30 December 2022 |archive-url=https://www.pojo.biz/board/showthread.php?t=135212#post1520723 |archive-date=27 February 2005 |date=1 November 2004}} on October 12, 2004. ==Features== ''Dark Beginning 1'' contains reprints of [[Core Booster]] cards from ''[[Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon]]'' through ''[[Labyrinth of Nightmare]]'', with decreased rarity. In addition, it contains a few cards not previously released in [[Booster Pack]]s in the ''TCG''. ==Breakdown== Each pack contains 13 cards, consisting of 6 [[Monster Card]]s, 3 [[Trap Card]]s, 3 [[Spell Card]]s, and 1 [[Tip Card]]. Each pack contains 1 or 2 Rares. 12 ''TCG'' cards per pack, 24 packs per box. Includes 250 cards, consisting of: * 15 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 20 [[Super Rare]]s * 30 [[Rare]]s * 185 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== DB1-BoosterEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Beginning 1 (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Dark Beginning 1: Tip Cards (English)|Tip Cards]] DB1-BoosterDE.png | German
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Beginning 1 (TCG-DE-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Dark Beginning 1: Tip Cards (German)|Tip Cards]] DB1-BoosterSP.png | Spanish
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Beginning 1 (TCG-SP-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Dark Beginning 1: Tip Cards (Spanish)|Tip Cards]] ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,DE,SP | ue_galleries = EN,DE,SP }} {{Set list tabs|EN,DE,SP}} ==Trivia== * [[Yugi Muto]]'s appearance on the cover of this booster pack is taken from the title page for {{chapter|Yu-Gi-Oh!|325|ref}}. ==References== {{Reprint sets}} [[Category:TCG Booster Packs]]

{{Infobox set | image = SKE-DeckEN.png | en_name = Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution | fr_name = Deck de Démarrage: Kaiba Évolution | de_name = Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution | it_name = Mazzo Introduttivo: Kaiba Evoluzione | pt_name = Deck Inicial do Kaiba Evolução | es_name = Baraja Inicial: Kaiba Evolución | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＡＲＴＥＲ ＤＥＣＫ|스타터 덱|lang=ko}} —카이바 편— {{Ruby|Ｅｖｏｌｕｔｉｏｎ|에볼루션|lang=ko}} | ko_rr_name = Seutateo Deg: Kaiba Pyeon Ebollusyeon | ko_trans_name = Starter Deck: Kaiba Edition Evolution | type = [[Starter Deck]] | size = 50 | en_database_id = 13303001 | fr_database_id = 33303000 | de_database_id = 23303001 | it_database_id = 43303000 | es_database_id = 53303000 | ko_database_id = 72203000 | cover_card = [[Kaiser Sea Horse]] | en_prefix = SKE | fr_prefix = SKE-FR | de_prefix = SKE-DE | it_prefix = SKE-IT | pt_prefix = SKE-PT | sp_prefix = SKE-SP | kr_prefix = SKE-KR | kr_release_date = April 12, 2005 | en_release_date = March 1, 2004 | eu_release_date = March 2004 | fr_release_date = September 2004 | de_release_date = September 2004 | it_release_date = October 2004 | pt_release_date = 2004 | sp_release_date = October 2004 | prev = ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution|Yugi Evolution]]'' | curr = ''Kaiba Evolution'' | next = ''[[Starter Deck 2006|2006]]'' }} '''''Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution''''' is a [[Starter Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). Released alongside ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution]]'', they are the fifth and sixth deck in the ''TCG''{{'}}s Starter Deck series, following ''[[Starter Deck: Joey]]'' and ''[[Starter Deck: Pegasus]]''. It is also released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in Korean. ==Features== This Deck is loosely based on ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]'', but replaces some of the contents with more advanced cards, which includes some other cards Kaiba used, cards that help to advance his "power" theme, as well as including some generic useful cards that he never used, e.g. "[[Jar of Greed]]" and "[[Dust Tornado]]". Seto Kaiba's appearance on the cover of this product is taken from the title page for {{chapter|Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist|126|ref}}, albeit with minor changes in detail. ==Breakdown== Each ''Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution'' contains 50 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 47 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== SKE-DeckEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SKE-DeckFR.png | French

{{About|the ''TCG'', Korean and Asian-English preconstructed Deck|the Japanese preconstructed Deck|Structure Deck: Pegasus}} {{Infobox set | image = SDP-DeckNA.png | en_name = Starter Deck: Pegasus | fr_name = Deck de Démarrage: Pegasus | de_name = Starter Deck: Maximillion Pegasus | it_name = Mazzo Introduttivo: Pegasus | pt_name = Deck Inicial do Pegasus | es_name = Baraja de Inicio: Pegasus | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＡＲＴＥＲ ＤＥＣＫ|조이 덱|lang=ko}} —페가수스 편— | ko_rr_name = Seutateo Deg: Pegasuseu Pyeon | ko_trans_name = Starter Deck: Pegasus Edition | type = [[Starter Deck]] | na_prefix = SDP | fr_prefix = DDP-F | de_prefix = SDP-G | it_prefix = MIP-I | pt_prefix = DIP-P | sp_prefix = BIP-S | kr_prefix = SDP-KR | size = 50 | cover_card = [[Relinquished]] | en_database_id = 13302001 | fr_database_id = 33302001 | de_database_id = 23302001 | it_database_id = 43302001 | es_database_id = 53302001 | ko_database_id = 72202001 | other_sets = ''Starter Deck: Pegasus Deluxe Edition'' | kr_release_date = August 16, 2004 | na_release_date = March 30, 2003 | eu_release_date = March 2003 | fr_release_date = May 2004 | de_release_date = May 2004 | it_release_date = May 2004 | pt_release_date = 2004 | sp_release_date = June 2004 | prev = ''[[Starter Deck: Joey|Joey]]'' | curr = ''Pegasus'' | next = ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution|Yugi Evolution]]'' }} '''''Starter Deck: Pegasus''''' is a [[Starter Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). Released alongside ''[[Starter Deck: Joey]]'', they are the third and fourth deck in the ''TCG''{{'}}s Starter Deck series, following ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi]]'' and ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]''. It was also released in Korean in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG''). In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for Constructed tournaments on May 8, 2003.{{cite web |title=Duelist King Tournament |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |website=Upper Deck Entertainment Tournament |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030608064757/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/tournament/rules.asp |archive-date=8 June 2003}} ==Features== The deck contains cards used by [[Maximillion Pegasus]] in the anime, including a variety of [[Toon monster]]s. ==Breakdown== Each ''Starter Deck: Pegasus'' contains 50 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 47 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== SDP-DeckNA.png | English

{{About|the ''TCG'', Korean and Asian-English preconstructed Deck|the Japanese preconstructed Deck|Structure Deck: Joey}} {{Infobox set | image = SDJ-DeckNA.png | en_name = Starter Deck: Joey | fr_name = Deck de Démarrage: Joey | de_name = Starter Deck: Joey Wheeler | it_name = Mazzo Introduttivo: Joey | pt_name = Deck Inicial do Joey | es_name = Baraja de Inicio: Joey | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＡＲＴＥＲ ＤＥＣＫ|조이 덱|lang=ko}} —조이 편— | ko_rr_name = Seutateo Deg: Joi Pyeon | ko_trans_name = Starter Deck: Joey Edition | type = [[Starter Deck]] | na_prefix = SDJ | fr_prefix = DDJ-F | de_prefix = SDJ-G | it_prefix = MIJ-I | pt_prefix = DIJ-P | sp_prefix = BIJ-S | kr_prefix = SDJ-KR | size = 50 | cover_card = [[Red-Eyes Black Dragon]] | en_database_id = 13302000 | fr_database_id = 33302000 | de_database_id = 23302000 | it_database_id = 43302000 | es_database_id = 53302000 | ko_database_id = 72202000 | other_sets = ''Starter Deck: Joey Deluxe Edition'' | kr_release_date = August 16, 2004 | na_release_date = March 30, 2003 | eu_release_date = March 2003 | fr_release_date = May 2004 | de_release_date = May 2004 | it_release_date = May 2004 | pt_release_date = 2004 | sp_release_date = June 2004 | prev = ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba|Kaiba]]'' | curr = ''Joey'' | next = ''[[Starter Deck: Pegasus|Pegasus]]'' }} '''''Starter Deck: Joey''''' is a [[Starter Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Released alongside ''[[Starter Deck: Pegasus]]'', they are the third and fourth deck in the ''TCG''{{'}}s Starter Deck series, following ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi]]'' and ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]''. It was also released in Korean in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG''). In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for Constructed tournaments on May 8, 2003.{{cite web |title=Duelist King Tournament |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |website=Upper Deck Entertainment Tournament |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030608064757/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/tournament/rules.asp |archive-date=8 June 2003}} ==Features== The deck includes cards used by [[Joey Wheeler]] in the anime. ==Breakdown== Each ''Starter Deck: Joey'' contains 50 cards in total. {{For|the Japanese set of the same name|''Metal Raiders'' (Japanese)}} {{Infobox set | image = MRD-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Metal Raiders | fr_name = Métal Raiders | de_name = Metal Raiders | it_name = Predoni Metallici | pt_name = Predadores Metálicos | es_name = Predadores Metálicos | ko_name = 강철의 습격자 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Gangcheor-ui Seupgyeokja | type = [[Booster pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 144 | cover_card = Black Skull Dragon | en_database_id = 11101001 | fr_database_id = 31101001 | de_database_id = 21101001 | it_database_id = 41102001 | pt_database_id = 11101001 | es_database_id = 51101001 | ko_database_id = 71102000 | ae_database_id = 5000000004000 | en_prefix = MRD-EN | na_prefix = MRD | eu_prefix = MRD-E | fr_prefix = MRD-F | de_prefix = MRD-G | it_prefix = PMT-I | pt_prefix = PMT-P | sp_prefix = PMT-S | ae_prefix = MRD | kr_prefix = MRD-K | other_sets = ''Metal Raiders'' promotional cards | ae_release_date = October 24, 2002{{cite web |title=トレーディングカードゲーム |url=http://www3.ocn.ne.jp/~goti/dmtc.htm |website=Yu-Gi-Oh! Information Site |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20040507023431/http://www3.ocn.ne.jp/~goti/dmtc.htm |archive-date=7 May 2004 |language=Japanese}} | en_release_date = December 1, 2004 | na_release_date = June 26, 2002 | eu_release_date = July 11, 2003 | oc_release_date = | fr_release_date = June 25, 2003{{cite web |author1=Capturofox |title=Metal Raider !! |url=http://www.yugioh-deckcenter.com/ |website=Yu-Gi-Oh the DeckCenter |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20030807012658/http:/www.yugioh-deckcenter.com/ |archive-date=7 August 2003 |language=French |date=25 June 2003}} | de_release_date = July 11, 2003{{cite web |title=Die Metal Raiders kommen nach Europa |url=http://www.konami-europe.com/yugioh/de/news.htm |website=YU-GI-OH! Trading Card Game |publisher=Konami Europe |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030812080025/http:/www.konami-europe.com/yugioh/de/news.htm |archive-date=12 August 2003 |location=Frankfurt |language=German |date=16 June 2003}} | it_release_date = November 7, 2003{{cite web |title=Novità ed eventi |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20041021011442/http:/www.hobbyandgolf.it/ita/novita.asp |website=Hobby&Golf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20041021011442/http:/www.hobbyandgolf.it/ita/novita.asp |archive-date=21 October 2004 |language=Italian |date=7 November 2003}} | kr_release_date = March 9, 2004 | pt_release_date = June 2004{{cite web |title=Adiamento do Nacional |url=http://www.devir.pt/pag_index/nacional_yu.htm |website=Devir |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040605180008/http://www.devir.pt/pag_index/nacional_yu.htm |archive-date=5 June 2004 |language=Portuguese}}{{cite web |title=Bem vindos à Devir Livraria |url=http://www.devir.pt/ |website=Devir |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040610163620/http:/www.devir.pt/ |archive-date=10 June 2004 |language=Portuguese |quote=Chegou Yu-Gi-Oh! em português! Já disponíveis as expansões (boosters) Predadores Metálicos e a Lenda do Dragão Branco de Olhos Azuis.}} | sp_release_date = 2004 | prev = Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon | next = Spell Ruler }} '''''Metal Raiders''''' is a [[Core Booster]], which is a combination of the Japanese sets ''[[Revival of Black Demons Dragon]]'' and ''[[Metal Raiders (Japanese)|Metal Raiders]]''. The set has been released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG'') in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish and in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. There are three separate prints for the ''TCG'' English; North American, European and Worldwide. The Worldwide English set was released in ''[[Master Collection Volume 1]]'', and later reprinted in the ''[[Forbidden Legacy]]'' product. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for Constructed tournaments on July 1, 2002.{{cite web |title=Duelist King Tournament |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |website=Upper Deck Entertainment Tournament |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20021014234939/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/tournament/rules.asp |archive-date=14 October 2002}} In 2010, an [[Unlimited Edition]] North American version of the set (MRD-XXX) and an Unlimited Edition European version of the set (MRD-EXXX) was reprinted again and released with the ''[[Legendary Collection]]''. The ''OCG'' and ''TCG'' sets contain the same cards, but differ slightly in terms of card rarity. ==Features== ''Metal Raiders'' was the first ''TCG'' set to contain [[Counter Trap Card]]s, such as "[[Magic Jammer]]", and [[Common]] [[Fusion Monster]]s, such as "[[Deepsea Shark]]". It has a wide selection of [[Effect Monster]]s compared to the few in the previous set, ''[[Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon]]''. Highly sought after cards include "[[Mirror Force]]", "[[Solemn Judgment]]", and "[[Heavy Storm]]". ''Metal Raiders'' is the largest non-reprint set to date, with 144 cards. ==Breakdown== In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English sets, each pack contained 9 cards and each box contained 24 packs. In Korean each pack contained 10 cards. The ''TCG'' set contained 144 cards, comprising: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 22 [[Rare]] * 100 [[Common]] The Asian-English and Korean ''OCG'' set contained 144 cards, comprising: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 12 [[Super Rare]] * 18 [[Rare]] * 102 [[Common]] ==Galleries== {{See also|Miscellaneous Gallery:Metal Raiders}} MRD-BoosterEN.png | Worldwide English
[[Set Card Galleries:Metal Raiders (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] MRD-BoosterNA.png | North American English

{{Redirect|MIK|the organization in ''Yu-Gi-Oh! GO RUSH!!''|MIK (organization)}} {{About|the 2002 ''TCG'', Korean and Asian-English preconstructed Deck|the 2002 Japanese preconstructed Deck|''Structure Deck: Kaiba''|the 2016 preconstructed Deck|''Structure Deck: Seto Kaiba''}} {{Infobox set | image = SDK-DeckNA.png | en_name = Starter Deck: Kaiba | fr_name = Deck de Démarrage: Kaiba | de_name = Starter Deck: Kaiba | it_name = Mazzo Introduttivo: Kaiba | pt_name = Deck Inicial do Kaiba | es_name = Baraja de Inicio: Kaiba | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＡＲＴＥＲ ＤＥＣＫ|스타터 덱|lang=ko}} —카이바 편— | ko_rr_name = Seutateo Deg: Kaiba Pyeon— | ko_trans_name = Starter Deck: Kaiba Edition | type = [[Starter Deck]] | size = * 50 * 46 (E, F, G, I) | en_database_id = 13301001 | fr_database_id = 33301000 | de_database_id = 23301001 | it_database_id = 43301000 | pt_database_id = 13301001 | es_database_id = 53301000 | ko_database_id = 72201000 | ae_database_id = 5000000002000 | cover_card = [[Blue-Eyes White Dragon]] | na_prefix = SDK | eu_prefix = SDK-E | oc_prefix = SDK-A | fr_prefix = DDK-F | fc_prefix = DDK-C | de_prefix = SDK-G | it_prefix = MIK-I | pt_prefix = DIK-P | sp_prefix = BIK-S | ae_prefix = SDK | kr_prefix = SDK-K | ae_release_date = August 8, 2002 | kr_release_date = December 9, 2003 | na_release_date = March 29, 2002 | eu_release_date = December 2002 | oc_release_date = September 2003 | fr_release_date = March 26, 2003 | fc_release_date = July 26, 2003 | de_release_date = April 25, 2003 | it_release_date = September 2003 | pt_release_date = June 2004 | sp_release_date = October 2003 | isbn = 1-932241-45-0 | ean = 4-042323-316679 | prev = ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi|Yugi]]'' | curr = ''Kaiba'' | next = ''[[Starter Deck: Joey|Joey]]'' }} '''''Starter Deck: Kaiba''''' is a [[Starter Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). Released alongside ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi]]'', they are the first and second deck in the ''TCG''{{'}}s Starter Deck series. It is also released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and Korean. The set has been released in the ''Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game'' (''TCG'') in three different English prints—North American, European and Oceanic—as well as in European French, French-Canadian, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish. The European English, European French, German and Italian sets contain less cards than the other prints, each including 46 instead of 50 cards. ==Features== The deck contains cards selected from the Japanese ''[[EX Starter Box|EX]]'' and ''[[EX-R Starter Box|EX-R]]'' Starter Boxes. ==Breakdown== In the North American English, Oceanic English, French-Canadian, Portuguese, Spanish, Asian-English and Korean versions, each ''Starter Deck: Kaiba'' contains 50 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 47 [[Common]]s In the European English, French, German and Italian versions, each ''Starter Deck: Kaiba'' contains 46 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 43 [[Common]]s The missing cards would later be included in European releases of ''[[Magic Ruler]]'': * "[[Hitotsu-Me Giant]]" (MRL-E107) * "[[Ookazi]]" (MRL-E108) * "[[Pale Beast]]" (MRL-E109) * "[[Hane-Hane]]" (MRL-E110) ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Starter Deck: Kaiba}} SDK-DeckNA.png | North American English

{{Infobox set | image = SYE-DeckEN.png | en_name = Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution | fr_name = Deck de Démarrage: Yugi Évolution | de_name = Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution | it_name = Mazzo Introduttivo: Yugi Evoluzione | pt_name = Deck Inicial do Yugi Evolução | es_name = Baraja Inicial: Yugi Evolución | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＡＲＴＥＲ ＤＥＣＫ|스타터 덱|lang=ko}} —유희 편— {{Ruby|Ｅｖｏｌｕｔｉｏｎ|에볼루션|lang=ko}} | ko_rr_name = Seutateo Deg: Yuhui Pyeon Ebollusyeon | ko_trans_name = Starter Deck: Yugi Edition Evolution | type = [[Starter Deck]] | size = 50 | en_database_id = 13303000 | fr_database_id = 33303001 | de_database_id = 23303000 | pt_database_id = 13303000 | it_database_id = 43303001 | es_database_id = 53303001 | ko_database_id = 72203001 | cover_card = [[Black Luster Soldier]] | na_prefix = SYE | fr_prefix = SYE-FR | de_prefix = SYE-DE | it_prefix = SYE-IT | pt_prefix = SYE-PT | sp_prefix = SYE-SP | kr_prefix = SYE-KR | na_release_date = March 1, 2004 | eu_release_date = March 2004 | fr_release_date = September 2004 | de_release_date = September 2004 | it_release_date = October 2004 | pt_release_date = 2004 | sp_release_date = October 2004 | kr_release_date = April 12, 2005 | prev = ''[[Starter Deck: Pegasus|Pegasus]]'' | curr = ''Yugi Evolution'' | next = ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution|Kaiba Evolution]]'' }} '''''Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution''''' is a [[Starter Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). Released alongside ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba Evolution]]'', they are the fifth and sixth deck in the ''TCG''{{'}}s Starter Deck series, following ''[[Starter Deck: Joey]]'' and ''[[Starter Deck: Pegasus]]''. It is also released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in Korean. ==Features== It features many of the cards that [[Yugi Muto]] used in the third story arc of the anime, [[Battle City]] like "[[Gazelle the King of Mythical Beasts]]" and "[[Remove Trap]]", and also loses some of the cards that were used in the [[Duelist Kingdom]] season e.g. "[[Witty Phantom]]" and "[[Curse of Dragon]]", although a few original cards remains such as "[[Winged Dragon, Guardian of the Fortress 1|Winged Dragon, Guardian of the Fortress #1]]" and "[[Feral Imp]]". Yu-Gi-Oh! fans were also treated to the first release of the mighty "[[Black Luster Soldier]]" [[Ritual Monster Card]] and its corresponding [[Ritual Spell Card]], "[[Black Luster Ritual]]". ==Breakdown== Each ''Starter Deck: Yugi Evolution'' contains 50 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 47 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== SYE-DeckEN.png | English
